job_description:
The Surgery division of Johnson & Johnson MedTech, is recruiting for a Senior Software Engineer (d/f/m) in Munich, Germany!


At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.


At Johnson & Johnson MedTech, we are working to tackle the world’s most pressing healthcare challenges through innovations at the intersection of biology and technology. We harness our deep expertise in surgery, orthopedics, vision, and interventional solutions to design healthcare solutions that are smarter, less invasive, and more personalized. The MedTech Surgery organization was recently established to combine Ethicon’s best-in-class surgical portfolio with the Robotics & Digital Solutions portfolio. The MedTech Surgical organization is comprised of: Wound Closure & Healing and Biosurgery, Endo Mechanical and Energy, OTTAVA (Surgical Robotics), MONARCH (Flexible Robotics), and MedTech Digital.


The Robotics and Digital Solutions R&D group is building advanced technologies to improve healthcare, and we are looking for a

Senior Software Engineer (d/f/m)

located in Munich


to join our team. We're looking for an experienced software engineer with strong C++ programming skills to help us continue developing our core libraries and support tooling. This individual will be responsible for design and implementation of software solutions, as an active participant in all phases of the software development lifecycle. We also expect this individual to support maintenance of our internal infrastructure and tools used across multiple projects.


Key Responsibilities

 * Design and implement modern C++ software prototypes, components, and applications that are flexible and capable.
 * Improve our infrastructure for building, testing, deployment and documentation of software that supports the next generation of robotic surgery systems.
 * Design, develop and debug software for complex, multi-process systems.
 * Collect and transform requirements developed by multi-functional teams into software solutions for medical devices.
 * Share knowledge and provide technical guidance.
 * Actively drive design discussions, code reviews, and architectural decisions.
 * Bring passion, positive demeanor and a desire to continuously learn.




QUALIFICATIONS

Qualifications


B.S. or higher Degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering (or similar degree) or equivalent meaningful work experience.

Required

 * Minimum of 5 years of hands-on experience in software product development.
 * Demonstrated experience in modern C++ with a profound understanding of its compilation process.
 * Proficiency with DevOps tools such as Git, CMake, Docker, Conan, and Jenkins.
 * Experience writing multi-process and multi-threaded software with practical knowledge of how this software can fail.
 * Experience developing software for Unix systems and
 * Experience in Agile and Scrum methodologies.
 * Good command of the English language.


Preferred

 * Experience with other programming languages (e.g., Rust, CUDA, Python, JavaScript, Bash).
 * Experience with medical device development and related software documentation.
 * Experience with networking for distributed systems.
 * Experience with full stack development.
 * Experience with Real Time Operating Systems (e.g., QNX, VxWorks)


For more than 130 years, diversity, equity & inclusion (DEI) has been a part of our cultural fabric at Johnson & Johnson and woven into how we do business every day. Rooted in Our Credo, the values of DEI fuel our pursuit to create a healthier, more equitable world. Our diverse workforce and culture of belonging accelerate innovation to solve the world’s most pressing healthcare challenges.

We know that the success of our business – and our ability to deliver meaningful solutions – depends on how well we understand and meet the diverse needs of the communities we serve. Which is why we foster a culture of inclusion and belonging where all perspectives, abilities and experiences are valued and our people can reach their potential.

At Johnson & Johnson, we all belong.


If you wish to include or request support from the company's representative for severely disabled people as part of your application process, please proactively inform the responsible recruiter when you are first contacted by our Talent Acquisition Team – thank you.

job_description:
Job advertisement Id FT010 online since 11/2024

ANavS – Advanced Navigation Solutions has three lines of business: precise positioning systems, precise mapping systems and snow monitoring systems. The core of the ANavS positioning systems is a modular and flexibly configurable sensor fusion of GNSS, inertial, odometry, UWB, camera and Lidar measurements. The innovative positioning algorithms were developed and patented by ANavS and include newest RTK/ PPP and AI methods. The main products of ANavS are the Multi-Sensor RTK module, the RTCM base station, and the Integrated Sensor Platform (ISP) with 3 integrated GNSS receivers, an IMU, a wheel odometry interface, 2 cameras, a 3D Lidar, an LTE module for the reception of RTK corrections, and a processor for the sensor fusion. The ANavS products have a large range of applications including the automotive, robotics, automation, maritime, railway, aerospace, agriculture and mining industries.

You will be part of the agile hardware team and contribute to low level software components of the systems. We employ C/C++ in most of our systems for firmware, drivers, and other real time constrained components. Also, we use C/C++ for our sensor fusion code and some internal utilities. Your job will be to develop reliable, flexible and scalable code that keeps our products operational and fault tolerant in a wide range of operational scenarios.

You will work in a small, flexible and growing team with flat hierarchies and expertise in computer vision, deep learning, software development, sensor fusion and embedded hardware development. You contribute to exciting manifold projects, for example in the automotive industry, and work together with partners such as BMW, Continental, Intel, Schaeffler and KIT.




Your Tasks:

 * Development of C/C++ code that interacts closely with the sensor fusion
 * Development of firmware and drivers for next generation positioning systems
 * Hardening of implementations against security and safety threats
 * Adaptation of our systems to specific customer projects
 * Close cooperation with the hardware, software and sensor fusion team
 * Patenting and publishing of developed approaches is encouraged




Your Qualifications:

 * Comprehensive experience in C/C++ software development
 * Computer science degree (or comparable)
 * Good knowledge of C/C, recent features of C++ (C++14 and later) APIs, smart pointer, make, cmake, multi-threaded software, networking, object orientation, software testing
 * Experience with good coding practices and design pattern
 * High motivation to contribute to the technical development, ability to work independently and willing to adapt to flexible tasks
 * Team player with quick perception, reliability and accuracy
 * Good communication skills in English and German

job_description:
Company Description


InfoBeans Inc. is a global technology solutions provider with a team of 700+ professionals across India and US. Our core focus is to bring cutting edge solutions to our clients through our services in dual-shore development, staff augmentation, Outsourced Product Development, custom web and mobile applications, Content Management Systems implementation, and independent QA services.InfoBeans currently operates at CMMi Level 3. Our team of technology experts is skilled at applying industry best practices along with leveraging in-house solution frameworks to enable faster time to market. Our outsourcing strength brings the right blend of experience and cost-efficiency.

InfoBeans has been recognized as NASSCOM Emerge 50 in 2010 in India. InfoBeans has received Best Employer Brand Award & Talent Management Award in 2011, 2013, 2014 at the Asia’s Best Employer Brand –Singapore

We are an organization that emphasizes a great work ethic, stimulating challenges and most importantly, a “SECOND HOME” work environment. We strongly believe our people are our only and therefore, the most important asset. For more details please visit us at – www.infobeans.com




Intangibles:

We know the award winning culture at InfoBeans is something to brag about, but here are more reasons that might excite you to get out of the bed in the morning:

Great opportunities to grow in your career and earn handsome milestone-based bonuses for creating WOW and expanding our relationships with clients

Flexible work hours




Job Description


Title: Senior Full Stack Developer

Experience: 5-7 Years

Location: München, Germany

Duration: 6 months contract, possiblity of extension till 2019




In the role of Senior Full Stack Engineer (m/f), the candidate will be a member of an agile development team which architects, designs, develops, tests, releases, and maintains software products for our Java/Spring microservices platform. We are looking for person who has primarily worked on the server side of Java/Spring web application. The person should have good working knowledge of end to end application development, including UI development, ideally with Angular

Qualifications/Experience

 * Extensive experience in hands on architecting, designing and development of Java client & server, SOA, web based applications
 * Multi-year development experience with Java 8 and Spring framework developing high –available Spring (backend and middleware) applications
 * Must have hands on design and implementation experience of microservices, ideally with Spring Boot and Spring Cloud
 * Should have worked on architectural level – selection of design patterns
 * Should have worked on design and implementation of REST APIs
 * Experience with static code analysis tools like PMD, Findbugs, Checkstyle, SonarQube
 * Solid experience using Maven (ideally also configuration and administration)
 * Must have worked and used following technologies in one or more projects for significant period of time: Hibernate and/or Spring Data, Tomcat, IntelliJ/Eclipse, Git, Bitbucket, SQL/Oracle, OpenAPI/RAML
 * Experience using Scrum/Kanban ideally in international and distributed teams
 * First experience with Angular, Docker and ELK stack is a bonus
 * Good written and verbal English. German and/or Spanish is a bonus.


Qualifications


Areas of Responsibility

 * Implement engineering best practices like test-driven development, refactoring, continuous integration and design patterns
 * Agile design and development of object-oriented, highly-available enterprise backend and frontend solutions using state of the art technologies like Java, Docker, Spring, Hibernate.
 * Control and ensure quality of the delivered team artifacts through regular design and code reviews.
 * Able to work in a cross functional setting and have ability to communicate both horizontally and vertically about technical issues and solutions.
 * Actively contribute to the success of the internationally distributed Scrum project teams
 * Should be able to learn and implement new framework, design pattern and new methodologies.
 * Guide and support junior team members.

job_description:
We are an AI Platform that delivers tailored AI-enabled solutions for the AEC industry with ease and speed, at a fraction of the cost of bespoke ones. Our platform leverages advanced AI to enable construction domain experts to create complex use cases efficiently.




Tasks

We are looking for full-time interns (for min. 6 months) to solve some cutting-edge computer vision and deep learning problems and be a part of our product development.

The successful candidate will -

 * Extract and pre-process visual data from different data sources
 * Implement metrics to evaluate and compare the performance of different approaches
 * Discuss the task with customer-facing members to understand the problem and its constraints
 * Proactively experiment with, and implement ML solutions to the problem
 * Collaborate with ML engineers on model design, experiments, implementation, etc.
 * Integrate the solutions to a common codebase and demonstrate good software engineering practices
 * Communicate results and analysis regularly




Requirements

 * Pursuing (or completed) a PhD / Master's degree in Computer Science in a German or EU university
 * Experience with training, and evaluating Deep Learning models in PyTorch and specifically, CNNs or ViTs
 * Proficient in Python
 * Experimentation mindset to improve performance on the method with fast iterations
 * Good software engineering skills
 * Good communication and interpersonal skills
 * Ability to work in a team-oriented environment
 * Strong problem-solving skills
 * Fluent in English
 * Eligible to work in Germany




Preferred experience:

 * Trained models for one of these tasks - Object Detection, Instance Segmentation, Scene Graph generation
 * Worked with Large Vision-Language models
 * Worked with Autonomous Driving data
 * Extensive experience fine-tuning Deep Neural Networks on small, domain-specific custom datasets
 * Knowledge of domain adaptation techniques




Benefits

You will be a part of an inclusive start-up culture in a stimulating "work hard, play hard" environment. You will work with (and party with) great colleagues with diverse backgrounds. Team events and after-work activities are frequent at CONXAI. You will be empowered to bring new perspectives and create impact.

job_description:
MIT BERUFSERFAHRUNG

MÜNCHEN

VOLLZEIT



JOB TEILEN


Wir suchen für unser Entwicklungsteam eine:n motivierte:n Expert:in, die/der uns dabei unterstützt unsere wachsende IT Infrastruktur weiterzuentwickeln und mitzugestalten. Dabei kannst Du sowohl konzeptionell als auch in der Auswahl der Werkzeuge Deine eigenen Ideen und Vorschläge einbringen und umsetzen. Neben einer hohen Eigenverantwortung und einem breiten Anwendungsfeld bieten wir Dir eine Arbeitsumgebung, in der Qualität und Nachhaltigkeit mehr zählen als schnelle Lösungen.

Deine Aufgaben

 * Als Teil des Entwicklungsteams arbeitest du eigenverantwortlich an verschiedenen Themen im Bereich IT Infrastruktur, Netzwerke und Software Engineeing.
 * Du bist verantwortlich für die Weiterentwicklung, Automatisierung und den Betrieb unserer IT Infrastruktur und Netzwerke.
 * Du unterstützt das Team bei der Umsetzung skalierbarer Lösungen zur Entwicklung und Automatisierung/Orchestrierung unserer Services und treibst die Weiterentwicklung auf diesem Gebiet aktiv voran.
 * Du entwickelst kreative Ideen und Konzepte zur Verbesserung unseres Gesamtsystems.
 * Du arbeitest gemeinsam mit unserem Team daran, dass dezentrale Energieerzeugungsanlagen klimafreundlich und kostengünstig Strom und Wärme erzeugen.

Dein Profil

 * Du begeisterst Dich für die Energiewende und hast einige Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich IT Infrastruktur/Software Engineering.
 * Du bringst sehr gute Kenntnisse in mindestens zwei dieser Bereiche mit:
   * Entwicklung von Softwareprojekten (idealerweise in Python oder Go)
   * Automatisierung/Orchestrierung (Docker, Gitlab CI)
   * Linux- und Netzwerk Administration
   * Infrastructure as Code (Ansible, Terraform)
 * Du verfügst idealerweise über Erfahrung mit Data Pipelines.
 * Du verfügst über Erfahrung mit Cloud-Providern (idealerweise Microsoft Azure).
 * Du bist motiviert dich selbstständig in neue Themen einzuarbeiten sowie neue Ideen aktiv voranzutreiben.

Unsere Tools

 * Gitlab, Docker, Ansible/Terraform
 * Python, Go, SQL
 * Django, FastAPI, gRPC/protobuf
 * Grafana (Cloud), Prometheus, Loki
 * Und alles was uns und Dir hilft, besser zu arbeiten

Was wir bieten

 * Team: Motivierte Kolleg:innen und super Stimmung
 * Purpose: Sinnstiftender Job mit Beitrag zur Energiewende
 * Innovationskultur: Jede:r bringt ihre/seine Ideen ein
 * Flexibilität: Bei Arbeitszeiten und Arbeitsort
 * Workation: Jährliche Workation an wechselnden Orten
 * Benefits: 50€ steuerfrei für GuudCard oder UrbanSportsClub



Wer wir sind

Wir nutzen Flexibilität optimal für die Energiewende. Jedes flexible Energiesystem wird durch unsere Lösungen und Expertise dem Gesamtsystem bereitgestellt. Durch die Verbindung von Fachkenntnissen und IT-Spitzentechnologie steigern wir die Effizienz der Energiesysteme, generieren finanzielle Mehrerlöse für Kunden und tragen zum Klimaschutz durch CO2-Einsparungen bei.


Was wir bieten

Entdecke vielfältige Benefits, sinnstiftende Arbeit und vor allem fantastische Kolleg:innen. Bei uns findest Du echten Teamgeist und gemeinsame Ziele. Sei Teil einer Erfolgsgeschichte, die auf Zusammenhalt und individuellem Wachstum basiert und viel Raum für Deine persönliche Entwicklung bietet. Gestalte Deine Zukunft mit uns!

In einem Team voller hilfsbereiter, humorvoller und engagierter Menschen erfahre ich tagtäglich viel Freude dabei gemeinsam komplexe Aufgaben zu lösen, Entscheidung zu treffen und aber auch über einigen Blödsinn zu lachen.
FLORIAN MANNHARDT
Technischer Projektingenieur

job_description:
Allianz Digital Health GmbH (ADH) is a Munich, Germany based subsidiary of Allianz SE.

ADH has a dual mission: Developing cloud-based software applications for Health insurance and supporting Allianz units world-wide in optimising their Health insurance business along the value chain.

What does it take to develop outstanding software or to support Health insurance executives globally to achieve lasting success in their business?
It takes data, dedication, knowledge, and curiosity. It takes people who want to learn and work in a truly exceptional team.

If you feel inspired by the idea to be part of a winning team, and to see your work on data having tangible impact at Allianz units worldwide, ADH is the right place for you.

Tasks


 * Develop deep expertise in insurance data models and consult Allianz entities globally on data transformation
 * Drive data harmonisation and quality initiatives by contextualising data for different stakeholders
 * Independently organise, track, and manage data transformation projects with Allianz entities.
 * Communicate requirements and timelines effectively with various stakeholders.
 * Conduct raw data analysis, design and implement data processing and cleansing pipelines, and improve data quality.
 * Analyse and visualise data to identify new business potentials.Develop deep expertise in insurance data models and consult Allianz entities globally on data transformation
 * Drive data harmonisation and quality initiatives by contextualising data for different stakeholders
 * Independently organise, track, and manage data transformation projects with Allianz entities.
 * Communicate requirements and timelines effectively with various stakeholders.
 * Conduct raw data analysis, design and implement data processing and cleansing pipelines, and improve data quality.
 * Analyse and visualise data to identify new business potentials.

Requirements


 * Master’s degree (or Bachelor with comparable work experience) in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Quantitative Economics, Applied Statistics or related field
 * Several years of working experience in data engineering and analysis
 * High willingness to combine business know-how with technological skills
 * High level of analytical skills coupled with strong problem-solving capabilities
 * Ability to communicate complex analytical and technical content with insightful visualizations to a non-expert audience
 * Experience in the insurance sector is a plus; strong willingness to deep dive into (health) insurance data and development of good understanding is expected
 * Expertise in data modelling and Python, especially handling large datasets with PySpark
 * High degree of self-organisation, individual responsibility and decisiveness
 * Profound research skills to bring in outside-in perspectives and drive innovative solutions
 * Fluency in written and spoken English, German language skills are a plus but no requirement

Benefits


 * You will have business impact and see the results of your projects in markets across the world.
 * You enjoy Allianz Group benefits while at the same time working in a start-up culture with great flexibility in working style, freedom to shape your working environment, a super-flat hierarchy and fast decision-making processes.
 * You can balance your work and other commitments with flexible working hours and the chance to regularly work from home.
 * You work in a fun team of highly motivated colleagues, who support each other and celebrate successes as a team.

The Office is located in Munich-Riem (Willy-Brandt-Platz 3; Messestadt West U2).

We would love to have you join our team and look forward to your application!

job_description:
Here at The Exploration Company, we are developing, producing, and operating Nyx, a modular and reusable space orbital vehicle that can eventually be refuelled in orbit and that can carry cargo - and potentially humans in the longer run.

We want you as a talented Full-Stack Software Engineer to help us in our mission by developing software that drives engineering efficiency, enhances development workflows, enables seamless operations, and simplifies testing. This role involves designing, implementing, and maintaining solutions that empower teams across TEC.




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



In your capacity as a Full-Stack Software Engineer you will:

 * Develop responsive and robust software solutions that are used throughout TEC

 * Own and deliver the entire software development lifecycle

 * Build software that scales effectively with TEC's expanding mission

 * Partner with engineering, testing, and operations teams to understand and meet needs

 * Write performant, maintainable, and well-documented code

 * Ensure reliability through rigorous automated and manual testing

 * Mentor less experienced team members and support end-users




WHAT WE WOULD LOVE TO SEE FROM YOU



The ideal candidate will have:

 * Proficiency in at least one object oriented programming language like C#, Java, or similar

 * Front-end experience in React, Vue, or similar JavaScript frameworks

 * Experience with the version control Git

 * Familiarity with test automation frameworks

 * Database experience with PostgreSQL, InfluxDB or similar database technologies

 * Good understanding of software design patterns and best practices

 * Hands-on experience with agile software development methodologies

 * Motivation to work in a fast-paced environment with strict deadlines

 * High attention to detail with an ability to balance quality & speed

 * Strong analytical and problem-solving skills



Bonus qualifications:

 * Experience with public cloud providers such as AWS or Azure

 * Familiarity with containerization and CI/CD pipelines

 * Space industry experience

Why you should join us!

What makes us special here at The Exploration Company and why we think you will enjoy working here is:

 * We’re Agile - we make decisions fast whilst keeping our goals and systems in mind

 * We’re Open and Collaborative - we are transparent about risks and obstacles, so that we can cooperate to overcome them

 * We have a lot of Fun - we refuel our energy knowing we are democratising space. It’s a wonderful and rare opportunity, are YOU up for the challenge?

We'd love to hear from you if you wish to be a part of our journey. Please submit your CV now for immediate consideration and we will be in touch shortly.

The Exploration Company is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. job_description_html:
Here at The Exploration Company, we are developing, producing, and operating Nyx, a modular and reusable space orbital vehicle that can eventually be refuelled in orbit and that can carry cargo - and potentially humans in the longer run.

We want you as a talented Full-Stack Software Engineer to help us in our mission by developing software that drives engineering efficiency, enhances development workflows, enables seamless operations, and simplifies testing. This role involves designing, implementing, and maintaining solutions that empower teams across TEC.

Key Responsibilities

In your capacity as a Full-Stack Software Engineer you will:

  • Develop responsive and robust software solutions that are used throughout TEC

  • Own and deliver the entire software development lifecycle

  • Build software that scales effectively with TEC's expanding mission

  • Partner with engineering, testing, and operations teams to understand and meet needs

  • Write performant, maintainable, and well-documented code

  • Ensure reliability through rigorous automated and manual testing

  • Mentor less experienced team members and support end-users

What we would love to see from you

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Proficiency in at least one object oriented programming language like C#, Java, or similar

  • Front-end experience in React, Vue, or similar JavaScript frameworks

  • Experience with the version control Git

  • Familiarity with test automation frameworks

  • Database experience with PostgreSQL, InfluxDB or similar database technologies

  • Good understanding of software design patterns and best practices

  • Hands-on experience with agile software development methodologies

  • Motivation to work in a fast-paced environment with strict deadlines

  • High attention to detail with an ability to balance quality & speed

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Bonus qualifications:

  • Experience with public cloud providers such as AWS or Azure

  • Familiarity with containerization and CI/CD pipelines

  • Space industry experience

Why you should join us!

We'd love to hear from you if you wish to be a part of our journey. Please submit your CV now for immediate consideration and we will be in touch shortly.

job_description:
WHAT'S THE ROLE?

Located in Kaufering, you will work on the next generation of battery-driven power tools and have the opportunity to bring your software engineering skills to the next level!

WHO IS HILTI?

Hilti is the place where innovation is used to improve productivity, safety and sustainability in the global construction industry and beyond. Where strong customer relationships create solutions that make it possible to build a better future. Where 34,000 people at 120 different locations worldwide are proud to be part of the team. Where people are given the opportunity to explore their possibilities, develop their potential, take responsibility for their own personal development and build their careers for the long term.

WHAT DOES THE ROLE INVOLVE?

As part of the embedded software team, you will be working on different tasks, for example in those areas:


 * adaption of existing embedded software projects, using C and e.g. STM32 microcontrollers
 * further development of base libraries and testing frameworks
 * creation and adaptation of scripts in the field of task automation using python

Depending on your interests and the day-to-day needs, you’ll have the possibility to dive into various domains.



We have 800 of the world’s best engineers developing and testing tomorrow’s technical solutions in our innovation centers in Liechtenstein and Kaufering.

WHAT DO WE OFFER?

We offer you a unique place to work, in which you are part of a creative and interdisciplinary team. At Hilti, you get everything you need to develop and succeed during your studies. In addition, we offer you innovative Benefits, such as fitness and health offers.
Integrity, courage, teamwork and commitment are essential for Hilti – both today and tomorrow. We are proud to say that we not only talk about our values, but also live them every day.

The Hilti Group's mission is "Making Construction Better", based on a passionate and inclusive team and an employee- and performance-oriented corporate culture.

WHAT YOU NEED IS:



 * Looking for an internship
 * Currently studying mechatronics, electrical engineering, computer science, or similar
 * Programming skills in C/C++ or Python
 * Experience with microcontrollers, embedded systems
 * Will to learn and work independently
 * Good communication skills in English or German



WHY SHOULD YOU APPLY?

You will be deeply involved in the development of next-generation power tools and experience the evolution of a product from concept to mass production. Your work will directly contribute to one of our products that will finally go to market.



Reference number: 30314

During your job interview you will spend some time with us and get to know our company. Thus you will get a feeling for the job and our corporate culture.

Hilti stands for equal opportunities. We are looking forward to receiving applications from severely disabled persons and similarly disabled persons.

Contact: Hilti Entwicklungsgesellschaft mbH I Human Resources

Should you encounter technical problems during your application, please contact mycareer-techsupport@hilti.com .

APPLY NOW


Share

Save



BE WHERE YOU BELONG

Find your future in a market-leading business with a truly caring and performance-driven culture.

Who We Are




EXPLORE YOUR STRENGTHS

Here at Hilti, we focus on potential over track record, giving you the chance to build on your strengths and grow your skills

Who We Are




BUILD A BETTER FUTURE

Ever since our foundation, we have focused on innovation to drive our success and help build a better future for our customers.

How We Work

  • Flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle: Sabbatical, flexible Arbeitsplätze, Gleitzeit, Zeitwertkonten uvm. 
  • Kooperation mit der Kindertagesstätte Kauferinger Sonnenkäfer (Standort Kaufering)
  • Hilti Sommercamp zur Ferienbetreuung von 6- bis 12-Jährigen (Standort Kaufering)
GESUNDHEIT UND SPORT
  • Verschiedene Fitness- und Gesundheitsangebote: geförderte Mitgliedschaften in deutschlandweitem Fitnessnetzwerk und Online-Training per App sowie kostenfreier Fitnessbereich am Standort Kaufering
  • Bezuschusste Sport- und Gesundheitskurse 
  • Höhenverstellbare Tische sowie bezuschusste Bildschirmarbeitsplatzbrille
  • Förderung gesunder Ernährung beispielsweise durch kostenfreies Obst in den Wintermonaten sowie ausgewogenes Speisen-Angebot 
VERSICHERUNGEN UND VORSORGE
  • Gruppenunfallversicherung
  • Vergünstigte private Krankenzusatzversicherung für Mitarbeitende
  • Betriebliche Altersvorsorge sowie externes Beratungsportal zur arbeitnehmerfinanzierten Altersvorsorge
PRÄMIEN UND SERVICES
  • Mitarbeiterbeteiligung am Unternehmenserfolg sowie Jubiläumszuwendungen
  • Prämienprogramm „Mitarbeitende-werben-Mitarbeitende“
  • Kostenloser Geräteverleih (Standort Kaufering) und vergünstigter Gerätekauf

  • Bezuschusstes Personalrestaurant und Kaffeebar (Standort Kaufering) sowie kostenfreie Wasserspender

job_description:
Munich, Germany

Are you passionate about technology and the disruption of the financial industry? We at CRX Markets are constantly seeking creative thinkers. We are offering the possibility to step up your professional development through hands-on experience in a state-of-the-art FinTech environment. Our platform is built for the cloud ensuring high scalability and resilience, and integrates with external systems via heavy duty middleware. We’ve already attracted some of the largest multinational corporates, but to stay ahead of the game we need to further drive innovation and are therefore looking for the best talents to join our team.


YOUR ROLE

 * Analyze functional requirements
 * Design test cases
 * Perform manual functional and regression testing and report results
 * Continuously improve existing QA practices and procedures


YOUR PROFILE

 * Degree in Computer Science or a related field
 * 5+ years of software testing and/or software development experience working with enterprise applications – preferably in financial industry
 * Knowledge and/or experience in SCRUM & agile requirements engineering
 * Experience with Microservices
 * Reasonable English skills
 * Strong analytical, organizational & prioritization skills
 * Experience with SOAP-UI is a plus


OUR OFFER

This position provides the opportunity to be part of a great team in a high-paced FinTech environment. You get the unique chance to push your career by gaining first-hand business experience from a network of the most innovative and capable minds in the German finance industry. While aligning CRX’s long-term goals with our employees’ compensation, we offer an attractive package with several perks and benefits.

Are you up for the challenge? Please upload your documents including CV, cover letter and your earliest possible starting date. Additionally, please provide a short statement on how you see the QA role on the project in the message field.

job_description:
(https://vimeo.com/534490180)




OUR PROMISE:

We are building a software company where smart and creative minds like you do their best to make the real estate industry a driving force for positive change.

With us, you can grow by taking on the challenges of a centuries-old industry, pushing boundaries and changing mindsets for the better.

With us, you can bring your energy, your passion and your ideas and find the perfect place to reach your best form.

Are you looking for an opportunity to grow and join an amazing team of frontrunners?




HERE'S YOUR CHANCE! - OUR ENGINEERING TEAM IS LOOKING FOR SUPPORT.




SENIOR FRONTEND ENGINEER (M/F/X)


YOUR MISSION:

 * Together with your team, you seek to understand customers' problems and what they need, then deliver high quality software to solve those problems.
 * You work directly with UX/UI designers in your team through initial user flow sketching, prototyping with customers, and eventually bring their designs to life in the product.
 * You strive to deliver the best possible experience for our users by empowering them through an effective and intuitive UI.
 * You build features with a “you build it, you run it” mindset and are responsible for testing, deployment, and monitoring of your code.
 * You use your experience and act as a mentor to help your teammates grow, and are equally open to learning from them too.

You want to have insights about the Engineering team? Visit our Techblog (https://alasco.tech/) to get to know more!


WHO YOU ARE:

 * You have a degree in Computer Science or a comparable field. We are open to an alternate career path as well.
 * You value communication skills (written and spoken), and can effectively manage discussions with your technical and non-technical colleagues alike.
 * You bring several years of work experience as a Software Engineer and are more than ready for a new challenge.
 * You are knowledgeable about the web platform and understand how to utilise that in order to build scalable applications.
 * You have experience in system design and how to maintain codebases within cross-functional teams.
 * You have an understanding of software testing, especially in testing frontend applications.
 * You favor open communication, constant feedback and effective decision paths that optimise for learning.
 * You have a “never-stop-learning” attitude and a desire to develop and grow.
 * You are fluent in English (Level C1).


NICE TO HAVE:

 * You have worked in an agile development team with other disciplines (product management, design).
 * Familiarity with design systems (using or maintaining).
 * You value good frontend tooling to increase the Developer Experience for everybody.


WHAT TOOLS WE USE:

 * Frontend: TypeScript/React with our own Design System called Bricks
 * Frontend testing: Jest w/ React Testing Library, Playwright
 * Frontend tooling: Webpack using ESbuild, ESLint, Prettier
 * Backend: Python 3 (Django 5), FastAPI
 * Infrastructure: AWS, Kubernetes
 * Database: Postgres


HOW YOUR FIRST MONTH WILL BE:

 * You have an onboarding buddy from day one to get you on board and help you with all questions on the way.
 * You directly start in a team which helps you to get quickly hands-on and see your first contributions to the product in the first week already.
 * You have regular check-ins with your supervisor to see if your onboarding plan is working for you and where we can provide support to improve your experience.


WHAT WE OFFER:

 * Scale-up Culture
   With our experienced founding team and our flat hierarchies, we provide an environment in which everyone can give their best and grow individually. Convince yourself: ✭✭✭✭✭ 4,5 stars on kununu.com/de/alasco (http://kununu.com/de/alasco1)
 * Development & Learning
   We offer you an annual development budget of two thousand euros and three individually applicable training days.
 * Participation
   You will receive shares in Alasco through our Employee Stock Option Plans and actively benefit from the growth and success of Alasco.
 * Trust & Flexibility
   We offer you permanent contracts, flexible working hours, flex week (2 days office & 3 days flexible) and workation in other EU countries. We offer you a lot of personal responsibility and creative opportunities to promote your goal-oriented career.
 * Openness and Appreciation
   We live an open feedback culture with regular 1:1s with your Team Lead & quarterly feedback meetings.
 * We strive as a team!
   That's why we organize regular team events where everyone can get to know the Alasco team and have fun together.
 * Wellbeing at work
   We offer you high-quality work materials, an office in a top location (Leopoldstraße 21, U-Bahn station Giselastraße), fantastic coffee and tea and our muesli and fruit bar.
 * Mobility & Sports
   You can choose between sporting activities with the EGYM Wellpass or diverse mobility offers with Navit.



Diversity, equity and inclusion at Alasco

At Alasco, we believe that diversity makes us stronger. We promote a corporate culture based on mutual respect, inclusion and equal opportunities. Regardless of gender, background, age, sexual orientation, religion or physical ability, we welcome everyone.

Our aim is to create an environment in which everyone can flourish. Together, we want to overcome boundaries, create innovative solutions and actively shape the future.

We treat all applications with the utmost care and confidentiality. Every decision in our application process is based on qualifications, potential and alignment with our values - free from prejudice or discrimination. Be yourself - and become part of our team!

Alasco does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Alasco will not pay any third-party agency or company that it does not have a signed agreement with.

  • You have worked in an agile development team with other disciplines (product management, design).
  • Familiarity with design systems (using or maintaining).
  • You value good frontend tooling to increase the Developer Experience for everybody.

What tools we use:

  • Frontend: TypeScript/React with our own Design System called Bricks
  • Frontend testing: Jest w/ React Testing Library, Playwright
  • Frontend tooling: Webpack using ESbuild, ESLint, Prettier
  • Backend: Python 3 (Django 5), FastAPI
  • Infrastructure: AWS, Kubernetes
  • Database: Postgres

How your first month will be:

  • You have an onboarding buddy from day one to get you on board and help you with all questions on the way.
  • You directly start in a team which helps you to get quickly hands-on and see your first contributions to the product in the first week already.
  • You have regular check-ins with your supervisor to see if your onboarding plan is working for you and where we can provide support to improve your experience.

What we offer:

  • Scale-up Culture
    With our experienced founding team and our flat hierarchies, we provide an environment in which everyone can give their best and grow individually. Convince yourself: ✭✭✭✭✭ 4,5 stars on kununu.com/de/alasco (http://kununu.com/de/alasco1)
  • Development & Learning
    We offer you an annual development budget of two thousand euros and three individually applicable training days.
  • Participation
    You will receive shares in Alasco through our Employee Stock Option Plans and actively benefit from the growth and success of Alasco.
  • Trust & Flexibility
    We offer you permanent contracts, flexible working hours, flex week (2 days office & 3 days flexible) and workation in other EU countries. We offer you a lot of personal responsibility and creative opportunities to promote your goal-oriented career.
  • Openness and Appreciation
    We live an open feedback culture with regular 1:1s with your Team Lead & quarterly feedback meetings.
  • We strive as a team!
    That's why we organize regular team events where everyone can get to know the Alasco team and have fun together.
  • Wellbeing at work
    We offer you high-quality work materials, an office in a top location (Leopoldstraße 21, U-Bahn station Giselastraße), fantastic coffee and tea and our muesli and fruit bar.
  • Mobility & Sports
    You can choose between sporting activities with the EGYM Wellpass or diverse mobility offers with Navit.

Diversity, equity and inclusion at Alasco

At Alasco, we believe that diversity makes us stronger. We promote a corporate culture based on mutual respect, inclusion and equal opportunities. Regardless of gender, background, age, sexual orientation, religion or physical ability, we welcome everyone.

Our aim is to create an environment in which everyone can flourish. Together, we want to overcome boundaries, create innovative solutions and actively shape the future.

We treat all applications with the utmost care and confidentiality. Every decision in our application process is based on qualifications, potential and alignment with our values - free from prejudice or discrimination. Be yourself - and become part of our team!

Alasco does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Alasco will not pay any third-party agency or company that it does not have a signed agreement with.

Our Promise:

We are building a software company where smart and creative minds like you do their best to make the real estate industry a driving force for positive change.

With us, you can grow by taking on the challenges of a centuries-old industry, pushing boundaries and changing mindsets for the better.

With us, you can bring your energy, your passion and your ideas and find the perfect place to reach your best form.

Are you looking for an opportunity to grow and join an amazing team of frontrunners?

Here's your chance! - Our Engineering team is looking for support.

Senior Frontend Engineer (m/f/x)

Your Mission:

  • Together with your team, you seek to understand customers' problems and what they need, then deliver high quality software to solve those problems.
  • You work directly with UX/UI designers in your team through initial user flow sketching, prototyping with customers, and eventually bring their designs to life in the product.
  • You strive to deliver the best possible experience for our users by empowering them through an effective and intuitive UI.
  • You build features with a “you build it, you run it” mindset and are responsible for testing, deployment, and monitoring of your code.
  • You use your experience and act as a mentor to help your teammates grow, and are equally open to learning from them too.

You want to have insights about the Engineering team? Visit our Techblog (https://alasco.tech/) to get to know more!
